attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of wards at Cheadle, Staffordshire, hospital.
attributes.background: The closure of wards will result in local residents having to travel long distances to other hospitals - mainly to the Royal Stoke hospital which is already under extreme pressure from the sheer volume of patients.
attributes.additional_details: Royal Stoke hospital lacks parking for visitors - Cheadle is well provided for parking spaces. It is also well run and well liked by local residents.

attributes.action: The Abolition of the Monarchy to be in effect as soon as possible
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, want to abolish the Monarchy due to many reasons.

Mainly due to them being out of touch with the majority of the public in the 21st Century, their unaccountability and constantly showing us how unequal we are in this country we call a democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The Monarchy still retains a lot of political power for an establishment that is unelected, being able to influence our laws on a daily basis, this is well known.
The Monarch retains the powers to appoint and dismiss Prime Ministers that we elect by a democratic majority whenever they choose, the last time this happened was in 1974.
Officially, we are subjects and not citizens of this country from the day we are born.
Also, we spend far too much on the Monarchy, this money could be spent better.

attributes.action: Give the NHS a percentage of tuition fees from all HE health careers courses.
attributes.background: The NHS would benefit from extra funding. They should be given a percentage of tuition fees from all health careers courses. Students studying these courses should oblige as the NHS is the future for the majority of their career. The extra funds would help with the upkeep and development of the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is suffering from a lack of funding and a lack of staff. If they were to recieve a percentage of student tuition fees (only from health related courses) then there would be a boost in funding. It could also be an incentive to encourage more people to study these courses and eventually work for the NHS, as they would feel as though there University costs have contributed to their future career on another level.

attributes.action: Stop legally classifying pets as property.
attributes.background: Pets are not property. They are loving companions, family members, they can perform important tasks. The theft, abuse, murder of pets causes deep psycological and emotional distress and crimes against people's pets must be taken extremely seriously in court and perpetrators severely punished.

attributes.action: Change in Immigration rules due to the immigration solicitors negligence
attributes.background: Our application  for leave to remain was simply rejected because our Immigration solicitor showed negligence in our application, after spending 11 years in UK we are now on verge to be removed from UK, I request everyone to sign this petition and bring change in immigration rules
attributes.additional_details:
We want Secretary of State to consider Solicitor's negligence as an exceptional circumstances.

For Example Law includes below as exceptional circumstances currently :
o travel or postal delays. 
or beyond control situation for applicant.
For example:
o The Home Office has lost or delayed returning travel documents.
o The applicant is having problems replacing lost documents as a result of theft, fire or
flood. 

but Point requested to be included in Law is as below:
o Your previous solicitor's showed negligence in your case and you have evidance from legal ombudsman to prove solicitors negligence.

attributes.action: Make councils turn redundant grace space they own into wildflower meadows.
attributes.background: Councils own lot's of patches of land next to roads, buildings  on housing estates etc; all that grows there is grass; it looks boring and the councils probably spend a fortune cutting the grass in the warmer months. Meadows are decreasing they need some help.

attributes.action: Save Remembrance Sunday Parades.
attributes.background: Due to a change in policy roads can no longer be closed. Unless local communities contract a road traffic management company to close the roads at a cost of thousands of pounds. Government should provide the council or police with extra money for these events to take place. Or these events will STOP
attributes.additional_details: local communities are devastated that their local parade or remembrance Sunday service being lost forever. The council do not have the funds for these event to take place. The police can no longer close roads due to a change in policy. Soldier's, have died in 2 world wars and various other conflict since, we need to ensure they are remembered in a fitting manner. These parades need to be saved for future generations so they understand the ultimate sacrifice that was made by these men and woman.

attributes.action: STOP the closure of Rotherham main post office
attributes.background:
Rotherham as you know has had bad press,
For the people of  our town many things have disappeared that once made this town a good place to live, buildings pulled down without consulting the people, 
now the main Rotherham post office  (3-5 Bridgegate) is next to be hit,
please put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
this post office is a necessity for the people of Rotherham.
a lot of people including the elderly  use this post office and in turn helps local trade as some have it as part of a day in the town center. it is necessary for passports, driving licenses, pensions ect ect, Rotherham as a town is slowly disappearing and it needs to be stopped, a once proud people are now seeing Rotherham town center disappear, contrary to popular belief not everyone has the internet and still need this post office

attributes.action: Stop ALL spending by UK Gov on Foreign Aid and divert it to the Care Budget.
attributes.background: We can't afford to look after our own citizens, but still send money overseas, why?  We must no longer neglect our own citizens, who worked hard to build our country and paid into the very same system that now neglects them but sends money to countries that do not need it!
attributes.additional_details: Raising council tax to pay for care, when it will not be enough or guaranteed to actually be spent wisely on care (that's if it gets into the care pot at all!).  We need to focus on those that paid into the system and look at the ways we should be working with everyone in our communities to integrate care and develop more beneficial caring environments for the future benefit of all.

attributes.action: Get the NHS to recognise 'visual snow' an illness affecting thousands.
attributes.background: Visual snow means seeing what looks like static everywhere in your vision, its neurological and not a mental health illness. But unrecognised hence the name 'visual snow'. Thousands of people suffer with it and it's being ignored. Something needs to be done.
attributes.additional_details: 'Visual snow, visual static, or persistent visual snow is a transitory or persisting medical disorder in which sufferers see snow or television-like static in parts or the whole of their visual fields, constantly in all light conditions, even visible in daylight, darkness and with closed eyelids'

attributes.action: Immediate ban on unregulated Private Parking companies from accessing DVLA data.
attributes.background:
Citizens Advice recently reported a dramatic rise in people seeking help about penalties for parking on private land – trebling from 16,300 to 50,000.
They should be forced to install parking barriers not Aprn cameras.
attributes.additional_details:
The injustice of heavy fines for small parking errors.
Victim’s mental wellbeing is never a concern.
They've mastered to make life difficult for drivers.
A group of private car parking companies threatened to take moneysaving expert to court an attempt to stop them from telling consumers their legitimate rights.
According to the DVLA, private parking operators have requested  details of drivers more than three million times in the last year, which has increased from 2.4 million the year before.

attributes.action: Provide free accommodation for ex-service personnel
attributes.background: As Veterans have served our country and risked their lives, why should they be left out in the cold with no food or water. All Veterans should be given accommodation after leaving the Forces until they are able to support themselves again.

attributes.action: Please don't wage another war in the ME after Iraq,Libya,Afghanistan now Syria!
attributes.background: Please send no troops, SAS special forces and clandestine operations into Syria. Unless Syria declares war on us, we shell stay neutral and not get involved in this war. We have our own country to care for. And we caused enough suffering and damage to the Middle East already. Please save the peace!
attributes.additional_details: The war on Iraq was based on a lie. The war on Libya caused death and suffering to the Libyan Nation and extreme damage to the security of Europe and the whole world. Yemen was bombed for many years by drones now by Saudis. Afghanistan is turning back into a unsafe war torn country under the rule of Taliban. Please save Syria and stay out of it. Let the Syrian Government and their Allies deal with their problem. Its not our Country. Not our war. We have a beautiful country to care for!

attributes.action: Get the government to remove stamp duty from buy-to-let property
attributes.background: The btl mortgages have dropped 60% since April when George Osborne brought in the states on btl and 2nd homes. This is damaging the housing market and the rental market for both renters and 1st time buyers

attributes.action: Require transport authorities to fund free concessionary fares for unpaid carers
attributes.background: Unpaid Carers (carers who do not provide care as a career) are a crucial part of society saving the government £162 billion every year. Travel is an essential service and yet, is a barrier that makes it harder for us to deal with our many responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: Public transport is a service that is a need, we are an essential part of the community so why can't we use it too! Not everyone can get benefits so let's help carers get what they deserve, it may not seem important to most but to many it will change their lives. We deserve to be treated as equals...Is free/concessionary transport for carers to much to ask for in return for those who dedicate their lives to care for others?

attributes.action: Make it law that all ice rinks make you wear crash helmets and elbow protection.
attributes.background:
As a child growing up going ice skating i never wore crash helmets or elbow protection. 
As a adult taking my own children I have not made them either wear protection whilst Ice Skating, but when they go doughnutting they do wear crash helmets Recently i suffered a head injury ice skating.
attributes.additional_details:
I fell smashed my head on the Ice and have been suffering server concussion for 3 weeks and still recovering,So the last 3 weeks my 4 children , grandma and my husband all have to look after me as I have not been able to do anything . 

Please read about concussion and sign the petition keep all our children and parents safe . Thank you for your time

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Commit to improve transgender healthcare in the UK
attributes.background:
In July 2016, I polled 100 transgender people and 60% reported their experience at a gender identity clinic (GIC) was detrimental to their mental health. 

The process of proving the validity of your gender in order to receive treatment harms individuals and it must be changed.
attributes.additional_details:
Full survey found on Beyond the Binary. While GICs are currently working towards reducing waiting times, the entire process is broken.

By signing this petition, we are asking the government to:

- Pledge more funds towards trans health care to address admin problems.
- Prioritise the work of the Equalities Office to address the harm that GICs are doing.
- Anything else that can be done to address the lack of NICE guidelines for treating gender dysphoria and means of treatment.

attributes.action: Make Ebooks (Kindle, etc) free from VAT.
attributes.background: Books are zero rated in UK for VAT because of their cultural and educational value. However, Ebooks (e.g. those delivered to Kindle etc) are not, but are hit by 20% VAT. Given that 'virtual' books do not require  destruction of forests, printing and distribution this is clearly unfair. Zero rate now

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation of Lancaster Post Office
attributes.background: Lancaster Post Office has become a historic local institution providing a wide range of services. Relocating it could reduce the service offered to customers in the long run, make access difficult for the disabled and the elderly and would be unsuitable for people who don't like crowded spaces.
attributes.additional_details: The current post office is spacious which enables it to offer a wide range of services, it is on the ground floor, very close to town centre, is a couple of minutes walk from a large car park on Dallas Road and is next door to the local Royal Mail Delivery Office. W.H Smiths would offer non of these advantages except the fact it is in town centre because there is no nearby parking and having postal vans would have to go through a pedestrianised area.

attributes.action: Do not open a UK trade hub in any state that discriminates against LGBT+ people
attributes.background: The Department for International Trade, led by Dr Liam Fox who has the worst LGBT+ voting record of any cabinet member, intends to open a UK trade hub in Raleigh, North Carolina. This is despite the fact that the state's HB2 permits businesses to directly discriminate against the LGBT+ community.
attributes.additional_details:
HMG should join Paypal, HP, Deutsche Bank and others in refusing to support North Carolina until HB2 is repealed.

The DfIT has a duty not to send its LGBT+ staff, contractors and their families to states which treat them as second class citizens in a climate of fear and prejudice.

HMG has a duty to the global LGBT+ community to send a clear signal, even to our allies, that this discrimination is totally unacceptable. HMG must stand up for those struggling against injustice everywhere.

attributes.action: Allow CCW in the UK for self defence
attributes.background: With violent crime at a whole time high in the UK.   And with the major threat of another terror attack,  it is a human right to be able to defend ourselves against this situation.  It is time for the right to CCW. (Conceal carry )   gun ownership for self defense can work in the UK.  Safely
attributes.additional_details: People always say the uk doesn't want to decommissioning another America when it comes to guns,  the media only report the criminal aspect of guns, they never report on the lives saved by the gun,  the crime stopped by the gun,   guns were banned after the Dunblane killings, but think.  If the kids were killed by a kitchen knife. Would the government have banned all kitchen knives, no..  gun ownership can work for self defense in the UK.  It is YOUR  human right to be able to protect yourself

attributes.action: Affordable Clear Citizenship Path for all who earned Permanent Leave to Remain.
attributes.background: This is vital in the context of Brexit as it would remove the threat of unjust deportation from many long term resident from the EU and is recommended in report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration Integration http://www.socialintegrationappg.org.uk/reports
attributes.additional_details:
The report by the All-Party Parliamentary Group (APPG) on Social Integration recommends "reducing the naturalisation
fees, which have recently spiralled to just under £1,200—almost ten times the cost to the Home Office of processing the application, and over six times more than the cost in countries such as Germany and Canada" and providing a clear guided path to citizenship for all long term residents from other countries including those from other EU countries.

attributes.action: Legalise the pharmaceutical production of THC for medicinal purposes.
attributes.background: Across the world THC has been proven to benefit a massive range of medical issues, from Anxiety disorders to Parkinson's disease. It is a neuropathic relaxant and can give those in need more control therefore enhancing their wellbeing, independence and reduces the use of other treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against this is the fear of drug abuse - which is already unregulated and rife. Unlike alcohol and tobacco; there is no evidence of overdose, violence or suicide under the influence of THC. It's neuropathic relaxants enhance endorphins.
In legalising the pharmaceutical production, companies can create a medicated and prescribable form of THC which can be monitored and managed by clinicians.
Presently, there are no controls and those in medical need suffer in desperation.

attributes.action: A  Vote of No Confidence in the Transport Secretary re Southern Railways dispute
attributes.background: The Transport Secretary has made it clear  he has no interest in the Southern/RMT/ASLEF rail dispute. People have lost their jobs, been refused job interviews & in some cases missed hospital appointments. His lack of action is grossly negligent and he should no longer be a government minister.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to show ID for age restricted products being purchased
attributes.background: Retail workers are fed up of being yelled at unfairly for following procedure when requesting ID for age restricted goods. They are at risk whenever a sale goes through. NO ID = NO SALE means a drastic reduction in this risk, and the onus is on consumers - NOT retail workers.
attributes.additional_details: I'm a retail worker. The very day i started this petition, i had been yelled at by a customer for requesting ID in order to ensure i could process the sale of Vodka. DVDs, Video Games, Fireworks, Knives. NO ID = NO SALE means the cashier is no longer at risk, has confidence to check ID without fear of intimidation and consequence,  put's the onus on the customer to ensure they have ID. This simple change would help prevent under age sales, knife crime, and give everyone confidence in the system.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for Parkinsons sufferers
attributes.background: Cannabis relieves Parkinsons symptoms and dyskinesia caused by Parkinsons drugs

attributes.action: Remove Toll On Queen Elizabeth the 2nd Tunnel if in traffic longer than 30mins
attributes.background: I cross this bridge everyday and I have had enough like many others paying £2.50 and upwards to be stuck in traffic for hours

attributes.action: Authorise open book examinations for GCSE English Literature 2017
attributes.background: The introduction of closed book examinations,for GCSE English Literature,requires students to learn and memorise quotes for this exam.There are 2 literature papers which include the content of:15 poems,2 plays and 1 novella.Exams shouldn't be a test on the student's memory,but how we interpret texts
attributes.additional_details: Students are expected to remember:quotes from each character & themes and context that are incorporated within these texts- it is estimated that 250+ quotes could be potentially memorised for this exam. On top of 20+ exams,students are experiencing high levels of stress- due to the paper being more demanding for a higher grade.English is a subject that all employers & universities look at, therefore if students are unable to realistically achieve high grades- there will be lower employment rates

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for Students
attributes.background:
In a world where equal opportunity and equality are valued. I see it unfair that millions of students suffering from Mental Disabilities such as ADHD are required to pay for their prescriptions.

Students have limited funds and I feel that those funds should be spent on books, not their medication
attributes.additional_details:
Currently I myself have to pay for my medication, I pay £8.60 for my medication to help treat my ADHD. Paying for the tablets that put them on par with those not suffering from mental disabilities is something that millions of students are facing.
1 in 6 adults have a common mental disorder (CMD), and those of which who are students are occasionally, like myself, facing the choice; food or medication.
This is something I believe should be a thing of the past

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: Increase the fine on mobile phone use while driving to a minimum of £10,000
attributes.background: I'm sick of having near misses while cycling to and from work due to car drivers illegally using mobile phones while driving. This problem is becoming an epidemic, it's time to get tough on the law breakers who endanger innocent lives.

attributes.action: Allow our FIREFIGHTERS to use seized & impounded vehicles for training purposes.
attributes.background: FIREFIGHTERS have to purchase scrap vehicles in order to train in essential skills such as roof & door removal, car fires & people extraction so that WE can be saved in emergency situations. WHY are we crushing vehicles seized at the roadside when we could GIVE these to the FIRE FIGHTERS!? Help NOW!
attributes.additional_details: Firefighters have to buy scrap vehicles from their own budgets at times when front line services are being cut and cars, seized at the roadside by the Police are being crushed into cubes when they could be used in training. Purchased vehicles are used VERY sparingly in order to extend training as they cannot afford to buy them when seized cars are being cubed daily. These skills that require practice save lives - please sign this petition as it could be your life saved by your signature one day!

attributes.action: Make the BBC a subscription-only channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: In 2016, people should not be forced to have a TV licence when they may not watch BBC programming. BBC could become a subscription-only channel akin to HBO (US) or a streaming service like Netflix.

attributes.action: Create a single Bullying Law that applies to all Schools in England
attributes.background: Schools are letting pupils down by not taking Bullying seriously and ignoring their policies. There needs to be a Law on Bullying that all Schools have to abide by. There are Children taking their own lives and i feel this would stop if there was a law that made schools help.
attributes.additional_details: News Articles. My own experience with my Child. I have spoken to numerous other Parents about their experiences too

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Ban cyclists using mobile phones whilst actively riding.
attributes.background: It has become evident, that there is an increasing number of cyclists on UK roads, pavements and cycle ways, utilising their mobile phones whilst actively riding. Not only are they putting themselves and pedestrians at risk, but the driver of road vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: If there were to be an accident involving a car and cyclist, the motorist would face consequences due to damage caused. There is an increasing call for drivers to be safer when it comes to cyclists, and the way in which they use the road (eg passing with enough space) but how do we guard against unsafe cyclists on their mobile devices, taking a call and/or sending a message. It is unsafe for a motorist and therefore unsafe for a cyclist.

attributes.action: Put cameras on Humber Bridge to catch speeders, tailgaters & poor drivers
attributes.background: The bridge is often closed for hours on end because theres been an accident caused by someones poor driving. The speed limit is 50, but drivers often go upwards of 60. The drivers are inches away from other car bumpers, trying to intimidate the other cars into going faster than the 50 limit
attributes.additional_details: There are cameras at the booths. These have witnessed road rage incidents, & drivers going through the tag lane above 50 (the limit at the booths is 30)

attributes.action: A newborn baby to be screened for Krabbe Disease
attributes.background: I have a best friend that tried years to get pregnant. When she finally become pregnant she was over the moon. She then become pregnant with her second child which was then found out to have Krabbe Disease at 13 months old which there is currently no cure for and they don't screen for when born.
attributes.additional_details: In America they screen newborn babies for Krabbe Disease but not in the uk. This is a very serious condition which there is no cure. It is a gene which one or both parents carry and can pass it on to the child without even knowing. If it's not found early enough then a child can die by the age of two years with late onset Krabbe Diease. This needs to become part of screening with a newborn ASAP. Please help make this happen!!

attributes.action: The U.K. Military should under no circumstances engage in the defence of Turkey
attributes.background: Given the recent provocative attacks of Turkey in the Middle East and provocations against Russia from Turkey the UK should not deploy any of its military forces as part of a NATO defence of turkey should they be counter attacked by countries that Turkey is antagonising.

attributes.action: Return the District Councils to Cornwall
attributes.background:
Since Cornwall Council was formed it has wasted so much money. 

It is time for the government to return Cornwall to District Councils and to abolish Cornwall Council.

attributes.action: Health Research Tax on all UK Taxpayers - let's finally cure Cancer and the rest
attributes.background:
A new tax used to fund Health Research, a small amount taken every month from all taxpayers and used to fund medical research. Suggested monthly figure for UK tax brackets:

Basic - 40p
Higher - 50p
Additional - £1

Such a small amount per person will generate £100m+ per year (HMRC Stats).
attributes.additional_details:
Based on HMRC Stats for 2016 tax year:

24.7m Basic rate = £9.8m
4.4m Higher rate = £2.2m
0.3m Additional rate = £0.3m
Total = £12.4m p/m

Funds to be given to single disease until cured then move to next (order TBD).

Suggest management board made of unpaid visionaries who are only interested in making the world better (i.e. Musk, Branson, Dyson etc.)

The Ice Bucket Challenge raised £87m for ALS research leading to the discovery of a gene that will allow them to start developing treatments.

attributes.action: Ensure that every train has a guard.
attributes.background: It should be a condition of offering a franchise to a Train Operating Company that every train has a guard. This improves safety and service and is reassuring for the travelling public, especially the elderly, disabled, and passengers with young children.

attributes.action: Make a&e more equipped with private room& bathroom when dealing with miscarriage
attributes.background: Its the most horrific experience for a women and her partner to go throught and should be dealt with respectful no women should have to sit in a room full of people or have to clean herself up in a dirty bathroom that drunks go in in a&e

attributes.action: Change to the Lifetime ISA rules (re: transferring from Help to Buy ISA)
attributes.background:
Allow Help to Buy savers who have 
- saved for over a year and 
- are going to transfer their savings into the Lifetime ISA on 06/04/2017 in order to purchase a home at over the £250,000 cap
be able to purchase a home at any point once the Lifetime ISA is open rather than wait another year.
attributes.additional_details:
"those who already have a Help to Buy: ISA will be able to transfer these funds into a Lifetime ISA and receive the government bonus on those savings...In line with the normal Lifetime ISA rules, Help to Buy: ISA savers will be able to purchase a first home with the government bonus 12 months from the date of opening their Lifetime ISA."

Source: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/508176/Lifetime_ISA_final.pdf [Accessed 31/07/2016]

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the misleading information by the EU Leave Campaign
attributes.background:
The nation's decision on Europe must be based wholly upon an informed choice and not upon misleading campaigns of false information provided by the Leave Campaign.
We ask such debate to take place in Parliament before any debate enacting Article 50 or any vote on it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/16/nigel-farage-defends-ukip-breaking-point-poster-queue-of-migrants
http://m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_576e2967e4b08d2c56393241?edition=uk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H8TA631ou0 and http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/3-brexit-promises-campaigners-wriggled-8271762 and 
http://qz.com/715877/the-backtracking-on-promises-by-brexit-campaigners-has-already-begun/

attributes.action: All Taxi drivers licensed to Halton have free travel across the Mersey Gateway
attributes.background: Currently all Halton residents Using a Taxi will have to pay £4.00 per crossing only to get back £2.00 per crossing this is putting us out of pocket as we where promised the crossing free of charge by David Cameron and George Osborne.
attributes.additional_details: This fee that Halton residents will have to pay will leave them out of pocket because we don't drive. There are also NHS resources that need Taxis to ferry blood to Whiston Hosptial and other NHS sites in the area. Also George Osbourne and both David Cameron have made promises http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Stop the Brexit process and declare that Britain will remain in European Union.
attributes.background: In response to the referendum the government is spending a lot of money on preparing to take Britain out of the European Union. This petition calls on the government to immediately stop this process and to declare publicly that Britain will remain in the European Union.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was unfair and undemocratic because millions of British citizens living abroad and at least a million citizens of countries in the EU resident of the UK were denied the vote. The great majority of these excluded people are in favour of the UK remaining in the EU and had they been allowed to vote, the result of the referendum would almost certainly have been to remain. I for example am a British citizen resident of Spain but was not allowed to vote so my voice to remain was ignored

attributes.action: Make the police buy cars that are made in the UK and stop buying premium brands.
attributes.background: The UK has a large number of people employed in the automotive industry,  buying UK built cars helps secure UK jobs,  there is no need for the police to have  expensive BMW imported cars and Jaguar premium brand UK cars when a Vauxhall for example make a cheaper alternative that is made in the UK.

attributes.action: GPs to be reviewed and retrained each time misdiagnosis of cancer
attributes.background: My son was misdiagnosed three times by GPs which lead to stage three. As they are the first point of call they need to spot this early and listen to parents. This happens too many times and no one is reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: I know of three cases, myself, two friends. All GPs incorrect medical knowledge of cancer.
